div.p: Greetings. For the past 3 weeks, I have been suffering from unbearable pains in my loins - I do not know whether it is sciatica (which tormented me terribly three years ago for a full 6 weeks) or if a stone is troubling me; certainly, I am constantly afflicted with dysuria, so you will forgive me if I am brief in writing; for now, in 3 weeks, I have only entered the church once; I also could not persist in the synod. As for what you wish to know from your last letters, I have received all your letters, two before, now one. I give thanks to you and to Mr. Lentulus, whom I ask you to greet most dutifully on my behalf, for those letters. I will send to Mr. Coccius his latest writing, as he requested. As for news, I have little or nothing to write.

The mission is postponed, I fear not with good counsel. We heard in recent days that a large sum of money was brought to Solothurn and an envoy is expected there. What will happen, we will hear shortly; I do not foresee anything good. It is certainly to be lamented that the Turks are triumphing; but this is perhaps by God's counsel, and here we will be given, I fear, Salmanazar and Nebuchadnezzar, a worthy reformer; for we do not want to hear the word of the kind father. There is a rumor that the king is now besieging three cities, Lucerne and two others, whose names have escaped me. Some say: "Even if there was some hope of peace before the king entered Italy, there is none now, after he came from Italy." Italy is the source of all calamity; so they and all who are Italian will receive their deserved reward, and let all the people say amen! Various rumors are circulating besides. I cannot and will not write more.
Greet the lords, brothers, and our friends. Farewell eternally with your household.
Zurich, October 22, in the year of our Lord 1574.

Especially greet and console the best and dearest man to me, Mr. Johann Baptist MÃ¼ller, whose plight I deeply regret, and since I can do nothing else, I pray to God from my heart to have mercy on him. May the Lord preserve him.
To the most honorable Mr. Tobias Egli, minister of the church in Chur, my honorable and beloved lord and brother.
To H. Tobias Egli, pastor at St. Martin.
